Based on the user's preference cues and genre suggestions, I would recommend two movies: "Zero Effect" (1998) directed by David Patrick Kelly, and "Flags of Our Fathers" (2000) directed by Steven Spielberg.

Both movies are based on true events from World War II. In "Zero Effect", the main character Daryl Zero is a dedicated bicycle rider who raises the flag at the Battle of Iwo Jima. Similarly in "Flags of Our Fathers", the main characters are the six men who raised the flag at the Battle of Iwo Jima.

Both movies have won numerous awards including Academy Awards, Golden Globes and more. They have also received critical acclaim for their storytelling, performances and more.

Overall, both "Zero Effect" directed by David Patrick Kelly, and "Flags of Our Fathers" directed by Steven Spielberg are highly recommended movies based on true events from World War II.
